ar.com.hjg.pngj

Class PngWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ar.com.hjg.pngj.PngWriter

  • public class PngWriter
extends Object
    Writes a PNG image, line by line.

        Parameters:
        file -

        allowoverwrite - If false and file exists, an PngjOutputException is thrown

        (overwrite=true)

      • PngWriter

        public PngWriter(OutputStream outputStream,
         ImageInfo imgInfo)
        Constructs a new PngWriter from a output stream. After construction nothing is writen yet. You still can set some parameters (compression, filters) and queue chunks before start writing the pixels.

        Parameters:
        outputStream - Open stream for binary writing
        imgInfo - Basic image parameters

    • Method Detail

      • queueChunk

        public void queueChunk(PngChunk chunk)

      • copyChunksFrom

        public void copyChunksFrom(ChunksList chunks,
                  int copyMask)
        Sets an origin (typically from a PngReader) of Chunks to be copied. This should be called only once, before starting writing the rows. It doesn't matter the current state of the PngReader reading, this is a live object and what matters is that when the writer writes the pixels (IDAT) the reader has already read them, and that when the writer ends, the reader is already ended (all this is very natural).

        Apart from the copyMask, there is some addional heuristics:

        - The chunks will be queued, but will be written as late as possible (unless you explicitly set priority=true)

        - The chunk will not be queued if an "equivalent" chunk was already queued explicitly. And it will be overwriten another is queued explicitly.

        Parameters:
        chunks -
        copyMask - Some bitmask from ChunkCopyBehaviour
        See Also:
        copyChunksFrom(ChunksList, ChunkPredicate)

      • copyChunksFrom

        public void copyChunksFrom(ChunksList chunks)
        Copy all chunks from origin. See copyChunksFrom(ChunksList, int) for more info

      • copyChunksFrom

        public void copyChunksFrom(ChunksList chunks,
                  ChunkPredicate predicate)
        Copy chunks from origin depending on some ChunkPredicate
        Parameters:
        chunks -
        predicate - The chunks (ancillary or PLTE) will be copied if and only if predicate matches
        See Also:
        for more info

      • computeCompressionRatio

        public double computeCompressionRatio()
        Computes compressed size/raw size, approximate.

        Actually: compressed size = total size of IDAT data , raw size = uncompressed pixel bytes = rows * (bytesPerRow + 1). This must be called after pngw.end()

      • end

        public void end()
        Finalizes all the steps and closes the stream. This must be called after writing the lines.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes and releases resources

        This is normally called internally from end(), you should only call this for aborting the writing and release resources (close the stream).

        Idempotent and secure - never throws exceptions

      • getChunksList

        public ChunksListForWrite getChunksList()
        returns the chunks list (queued and writen chunks)

      • getMetadata

        public PngMetadata getMetadata()
        Retruns a high level wrapper over for metadata handling

      • setCompLevel

        public void setCompLevel(int compLevel)
        Sets compression level of ZIP algorithm.

        This must be called just after constructor, before starting writing.

        See also setFilterType()

        Parameters:
        compLevel - between 0 and 9 (default:6 , recommended: 6 or more)

      • setFilterType

        public void setFilterType(FilterType filterType)
        Sets internal prediction filter type, or strategy to choose it.

        This must be called just after constructor, before starting writing.

        See also setFilterStrategy setCompLevel()

        Parameters:
        filterType - One of the five prediction types or strategy to choose it (see PngFilterType) Recommended values: DEFAULT (default) or AGGRESIVE

      • setFilterStrategy

        public void setFilterStrategy(IFilterWriteStrategy filterS)
        Set an alternative strategy for selecting the prediction filter
        Parameters:
        filterS -

      • isFilterPreserve

        public boolean isFilterPreserve()
        See Also:

        public void setFilterPreserve(boolean filterPreserve)
        See Also:
        filterPreserve

      • setIdatMaxSize

        public void setIdatMaxSize(int idatMaxSize)
        Sets maximum size of IDAT fragments. This has little effect on performance you should rarely call this

        Parameters:
        idatMaxSize - default=0 : use defaultSize (64K)

      • setShouldCloseStream

        public void setShouldCloseStream(boolean shouldCloseStream)
        If true, output stream will be closed after ending write

        default=true

      • setDeflaterStrategy

        public void setDeflaterStrategy(int deflaterStrategy)
        Deflater strategy: one of Deflater.FILTERED Deflater.HUFFMAN_ONLY Deflater.DEFAULT_STRATEGY

        Default: Deflater.FILTERED (for filter NONE usually DEFAULT_STRATEGY is a little better

      • writeRow

        public void writeRow(IImageLine imgline)
        Writes next row, does not check row number.
        Parameters:
        imgline -

      • writeRows

        public void writeRows(IImageLineSet<? extends IImageLine> imglines)
        Writes the full set of row. The ImageLineSet should contain (allow to acces) imgInfo.rows
